data.title: Support for setting minification and magnification filters on a texture in the j3m material file
data.body:
Added support for setting minification and magnification filters on a texture in the j3m material file. This also adds support for double and single quoted paths as well as being able to set WrapMode for a specific WrapAxis.

This PR also contains a slight change to a couple of build scripts to include the other modules as dependencies rather than have their sources referenced directly. This was causing an issue with IntelliJ IDEA which does not allow source paths residing outside a modules root.

This pull request resolves #295

data.title: Additional render state override for techniques

milestone.title: Future Release

It might be desirable to customize polygon offset for the PreShadow technique per-material. See thread:
http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/materials-and-forced-renderer-state/33138/12

data.title: Add new constructors for lights

milestone.title: Future Release
milestone.description: Features that will not make it into the next immediate release.

data.body:
Add the following convenience constructors:
`AmbientLight(ColorRGBA color)`
`DirectionalLight(ColorRGBA color, Vector3f direction)`
`PointLight(ColorRGBA color, Vector3f position)`
`SpotLight(ColorRGBA color, Vector3f position, Vector3f direction, float innerAngle, float outerAngle)`

data.title: Add a way to globally set anisotropic filtering value

milestone.description:
jMonkeyEngine SDK 3.1

Highlights:
- Gradle
- Native Bullet physics
- NetBeans 8.x
- iOS support

data.body:
Right now the anisotropic filtering has to be set on each texture.
It's very impractical as you usually want to set it globally.

There should be a way to set the filtering globally in the app settings and then apply this setting each time a texture is loaded.
User should be able to override this setting for a given texture.

data.title: Allow to set min filter and mag filter for a texture in the j3m file
data.body:
Textures can have diffrent convolution algorithm when they are minified or magnified on screen.
There is a way to change this algorithm by code, throught the Texture API.

Though when you make a material though a j3m file, and want different filtering, you have to load your material by code and change the filtering in the code. It woudl be nice to be able to set the filtering directly in the j3m file the same we specify Flip or Repeat.

The keyworkd could be any value from the MinFilter and MagFilter enum foun din the Texture class 
https://github.com/jMonkeyEngine/jmonkeyengine/blob/master/jme3-core/src/main/java/com/jme3/texture/Texture.java

But each keyword should be prefixed with Min or Mag for example : 
MinTrilinear MagBilinear.

data.title: add GL3 support for Unshaded and MRT (v2)
data.body:
I remade the PR #288 to have a cleaner diff and history (commit log).

The PR include a fix for  GLSL150Compat  (the version + auto-injection of the define XXXX_SHADER).

data.title: add TechniqueDef.noRender
data.body:
as discuss in [Ignore technique with no shader - Development - jMonkeyEngine Hub](http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/ignore-technique-with-no-shader/33012/10)

I forgot that java require so many boilerplate to add a public field, since I used more sweet syntax (scala, xtend, lombock).

data.title: Reduce uniforms
data.body:
I've found an issue with the uniforms. It seams that they are sent to the GPU even if the value hasn't changed.
In my game I was able to reduce the uniforms from ~10.000 to ~2000 which results in up to 15% of performance increase. For me it was about 10 fps more than before.

forum link: http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/performance-issue-too-much-uniform-updates/33016

data.title: Unclear error in BIHTree
data.body:
On [this line](https://github.com/jMonkeyEngine/jmonkeyengine/blob/e2d8fe829359dd6028d6810efddbf671d9980231/jme3-core/src/main/java/com/jme3/collision/bih/BIHTree.java#L117)  in BIHTree.java if the mesh does not have the `Position` buffer set up, the error is

```
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.jme3.collision.bih.BIHTree.<init>(BIHTree.java:117)
at com.jme3.collision.bih.BIHTree.<init>(BIHTree.java:130)
at com.jme3.scene.Mesh.createCollisionData(Mesh.java:885)
at com.jme3.scene.Mesh.collideWith(Mesh.java:905)
at com.jme3.scene.Geometry.collideWith(Geometry.java:408)
at com.jme3.scene.Node.collideWith(Node.java:494)
at com.simsilica.lemur.event.PickEventSession.cursorMoved(PickEventSession.java:367)
at com.simsilica.lemur.event.MouseAppState.update(MouseAppState.java:171)
at com.jme3.app.state.AppStateManager.update(AppStateManager.java:287)
at com.jme3.app.SimpleApplication.update(SimpleApplication.java:239)
at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglAbstractDisplay.runLoop(LwjglAbstractDisplay.java:151)
at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglDisplay.runLoop(LwjglDisplay.java:185)
at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglAbstractDisplay.run(LwjglAbstractDisplay.java:228)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
```

If a mesh is forced to have the Position buffer to be valid, won't a more clear message here or somewhere else suggest that prior coming to this NPE in runtime? The stack trace which is strictly within the bounds of the platform itself looks like it is an unexpected situation, and probably a bug..?

data.title: Improve compressed serialization
data.body:
The GZIP and ZIP serializer copying the whole temporary buffer instead of only the part where the data was written. This can be easily fixed.

Forum thread: http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/gzipserializer-creates-too-big-buffers/32925

data.title: [Nifty-GUI] Using java logger, instead of stdout
data.body: Replaced call to System.out.println() with proper logging call.

data.title: add GL3 support for Unshaded and MRT
Fix for ZipLocator and path with the root slash
data.body:
While for the FileLocator "/path/x.png" and "path/x.png" are the same location, the ZipLocator (since they are passed directly to ZipFile.getEntry) treats them as two different location, as it should be on a zip archive, but since there is no need of this for the asset manager I think it's reasonable to make both FileLocator and ZipLocator work in the same way.

I noticed this problem after I load a blend model from a zip file and its textures were missed because all path were starting with a slash. I'm not sure if the HttpZipLoader is affected too.

data.title: There are no locators currently registered
data.body:
I have a small application that uses the android system to render a scene. When I run it standalone. (Register the activity that extends AndroidHarness as Main) everything works as expected. When I launch that same activity with an intent from another activity within the same application I get a "AssetNotFoundException". As well as a warning "There are no locators currently registered". 

Ive been trying to track down the issue myself. I am thinking it has something todo with the loading of the Android.Cfg file. But I cant for the live of me understand why it works in the first use case, and doesnt in the second.

Anybody have similar experiences with this?

Im working of the trunk btw

data.title: Remove Caching .blend's (In BlenderModelImporter)
data.body:
Hey Guys,
This is just a little enhancement:
During my workflow I had to restart the sdk a thousand times, because each time I made a change to my blend file, I could not reimport it because the AssetLoader used the cached file.

What do you think? Should we (if possible?) remove caching for all blend files in general or only in BlenderModelImporter?

If someone would use a blender loader in his app, he would use the spatial multiple times, but not load it again. That would be a code-design fault then, anyway.

data.title: TestJoystick throws an assertion error when assertion are enabled
data.body:
When assertions are enabled on the test project TestJoystick throws this assertion error

```
java.lang.AssertionError
    at com.jme3.input.controls.JoyAxisTrigger.joyAxisHash(JoyAxisTrigger.java:52)
    at com.jme3.input.controls.JoyAxisTrigger.triggerHashCode(JoyAxisTrigger.java:73)
    at com.jme3.input.InputManager.addMapping(InputManager.java:561)
    at com.jme3.input.DefaultJoystickAxis.assignAxis(DefaultJoystickAxis.java:75)
    at com.jme3.input.FlyByCamera.mapJoystick(FlyByCamera.java:272)
    at com.jme3.input.FlyByCamera.registerWithInput(FlyByCamera.java:245)
    at com.jme3.app.FlyCamAppState.initialize(FlyCamAppState.java:75)
    at com.jme3.app.state.AppStateManager.initializePending(AppStateManager.java:251)
    at com.jme3.app.state.AppStateManager.update(AppStateManager.java:281)
    at com.jme3.app.SimpleApplication.update(SimpleApplication.java:243)
    at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglAbstractDisplay.runLoop(LwjglAbstractDisplay.java:152)
    at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglDisplay.runLoop(LwjglDisplay.java:192)
    at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglAbstractDisplay.run(LwjglAbstractDisplay.java:233)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
```

seems that the culprit is this line

```
  assert joyAxis >= 0 && joyAxis <= 255;
```

in JoyAxisTrigger.joyAxisHash. joyAxis is sometimes equals to -1.
This issue was found with  FF14 joystick, idk if others also thow the error.
Note that when assertion are disabled it works wonderfully.

data.title: Alpha problem in PBRLighting
data.body:
Since BaseColor's default value is (0,0,0,0) the gl_FragColor.a by default is equal to 0 and everything works fine, but if the BaseColor's alpha is setted to 1 the fragments where the resulting alpha is 1 look overbright.
See images below.

With gl_FragColor.a = 1
![sddafdaadf26](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4943530/7879175/574f7496-05ee-11e5-854b-e7af93c84aed.png)

With gl_FragColor.a = 0
![sddafdaadf27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4943530/7879177/585bab5c-05ee-11e5-9a75-a30fb001d937.png)

(The geometries shown in those screens are in the Opaque bucket and their texture has alpha = 1)

data.title: SDK SceneComposer : smalls changes and cleaner code
data.body: smalls changes : now the DeleteShortcut cannot be activated at the same time as and other shortcutTool (prevent form miss deleting). And cleaned some code to be more functional (reduce side effects). Get involved here : http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/improving-scene-composer-tools/32230/29

data.body: I've added the missing code taken from Lighting.*

data.title: SDK Menu at wrong position (Ubuntu Gnome)
data.body:
I just installed the jMonkeyEngine SDK 3.0. Apart from that it looks really ugly (like in the 90s) in contrast to screenshots I have seen, the Menu is quasi not usable. When I click on an item (e.g. "file"), the menu is shown at a wrong position, as you can see in the picture below. 
![jmonkeyengine sdk](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4456588/7803756/0ee0f2ce-032e-11e5-8d1a-3ba1b5f827cb.png)
It is beeing showed at exact the same position as on the first start of jMonkeyEngine SDK when it has not been maximized. But regardless of how I resize the window or restart the program, the menu will always be shown at that position.

data.title: Added GL_MAX_VERTEX_UNIFORM_COMPONENTS
data.body:
Required to know how many uniforms can be used in the vertex shader.

Probably also required by the hardware skinning?

The code was already in 3.0 but was commented out in 3.1, you probably had a reason for this i guess. 

Following some stackoverflow talk, on some ATI cards the returned number has to be divided by 4. Not implemented that because i have not access to testing machines. 

Returns 4096 on my geforce 780

data.title: Fixes the initialisation of the default SpotLight
SimpleBatchNode does not recalculate the BoundingVolume
data.body:
Bug occurs only if you never modify a sub item that was batched. 

All ok, if updateGeometricState gets called manually, or when a control is added to one of the sub items.

Here is a small testcase:

https://gist.github.com/zzuegg/43b2697d14913e679975

data.title: SDK SceneComposer : some refactor
data.body:
So smalls changes : now the DeleteShortcut cannot be activated at the same time as and other shortcutTool (prevent form miss deleting). And cleaned some code to be more functional (reduce side effects). Get involved here : http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/improving-scene-composer-tools/32230/29

ps : don't care about the two last commits, wrong branch commits ^^

data.title: SDK SceneComposer : new ShortcutTool
data.body: This add new way to manage shortcut for sceneEditTool, since there was all handled into the selectTool. Now this provide a much readable and easiest way to add new shortcuts to the sceneComposer. Plus each shortcut can be used with every other "classical" tools. For more information see : http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/improving-scene-composer-tools/32230/23

data.title: Added support for 16 bit GL_LUMINANCE Textures
data.body:
Not a new feature at all, but added missing loader for 16 bit grayscale textures. 3.1 loaded the files as RGB8, while 3.0 was loading a Luminance16 

Not sure why this feature was removed from 3.1. I am probably overseeing some big downside of this format. But i have not yet found any other way to load a 16 bit heightmap in 3.1 due to the missing formats. 

I am open to suggestions
